Reviews.Title: “Very nice facilities and a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: kigerdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Residence Inn in mid-March for 4 nights. It was a very nice hotel, great service, and Great location. My wife and I walked to CocoWalk several times and had 3 great dinners in the area. Front desk staff was attentive and professional, and the breakfast staff was excellent. They were smiling, very attentive with replacing the hot foods, and very diligent in helping to clean the tables. The room was fine and clean, and the TVs worked with no problems. I found the wifi signal to be weak, but the wifi worked OK. All in all, a nice hotel with good secure parking. I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Greetings and service”
Reviews.Author: pdtravel1
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and wanted to experience more of Miami Beach so tried to get close to the shore. This hotel is just a block from the beach near Miami City offices and what appears to be old town Coconut Grove. It is within walking distance of a park at the Marina and several other sites. The staff greeted me every single time I walked in the door, had suggestions on sightseeing, gave me directions, and were incredibly helpful. It was great. The hotel is a little older than some hotels in the area and is made up of several buildings around a parking lot. There's a garage below the main building that's a little tricky to drive into due the angles up, down and then the way parking is laid out. It did work but took some getting used to. There's a daily fee for parking but sometimes it's included in the rate package. All of the spaces I used - public areas, garage, my room were maintained and clean. Everything was in working order. I used the laundry facilities which had 3 coin operated washers and dryers. The fitness center had 3 treadmills, 2 elipticals, free weights and a cycling machine and was located right off the lobby. The pool is outside. I tried to extend my stay but the hotel was booked. It's a good place to stay, complimentary hot breakfast and evening manager's reception both of which were very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, good location”
Reviews.Author: amyemilia
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay at the Residence Inn Miami Coconut Grove. Booked on marriot.com and am glad that I got the room + parking package, which made my parking cost $1. This is an older building, somewhat confusing at first but after that it makes sense. The driveway entrance is very steep and very short - had to back up into the street when the truck in front of me needed to exit. Once I actually got into the lobby the desk clerk was friendly and checking in was quick. Parking underground would be a bit challenging if you have a large vehicle - the height restriction is 6'5" I think. My rental Impala fit in just fine and I felt secure behind that big gate. My room was in building 3 (the same as the lobby) and the elevator in the basement parking went straight up to my floor. Very convenient! The room itself was fairly standard, seemed clean and everything worked. I didn't like that the desk faced away from the TV - usually I like to work on my laptop with the TV on in front of me. (Granted, I mostly listen to TV but still...) Breakfast was adequate - scrambled eggs every day, Activia and Light n Fit yogurt, oatmeal, waffle machines (2). They should clean (or replace) the toasting machine. During the 3 days I stayed there, something burned every day and once there was actual fire. I recommend visiting the Fresh Market which is very close by - perhaps 3 minute drive. Similar to a Whole Foods or Trader Joe's - great fresh produce, good selection of food to bring back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: golfergeo
Reviews.Content: We wanted to come down to Miami Beach and see the Art Deco area of South Beach. However when I got to looking at the accomodations, I wasn't real happy with the reviews I was reading. We are in our 60s and aren't party all night-type of people. I didn't like the idea of a smallish room even though it was in a historic Art Deco hotel. In talking with an old friend, she recommended Coconut Grove area and this Residence Inn appeared to be a pretty good place to stay for a couple of nights. We drove into South Beach, spent the entire day taking tours and looking around, then came to Coconut Grove to rest up and enjoy the warm weather. We stayed in a 5th floor room with 2 queen beds. Large room, full kitchen (which we really didn't use, other than the ice maker), nice TV, old plumbing fixtures , nice & clean. I'm guessing this an old building based on the round ball control plumbing fixtures. At least they have instructions on the shower wall to help you figure out how to get hot water. Secure parking in basement garage that was $15/day. It was very convenient to get luggage in & out of car to & from room. Internet speed isn't sufficient to handle lots of data but it doesn't work (albeit with slow response) to bring up email and do tourist related research. Breakfast was very nice, raisin bran & fresh fruit, hot scrambled eggs, sausage one day and bacon the next, lots of table space (especially for the number of people eating at 8:45). Within walking distance to CoCoWalk, which has several eating choices that were very nice. We never were around the hotel to sample their evening food offerings but the desk staff made us aware that there was food available. Front desk staff, the lady that serviced the breakfast area and the staff we met in the hall were all friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Again, even with notable annoyances.”
Reviews.Author: zapoko
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line: I will stay at this hotel again. While it is border line for certain customer service items, I hope they can fix these. The location is second to none for Miami and for families.The hotel is clean, the breakfast good, and most of the staff professional. Coconut Grove is an excellent location for families. My wife and young son could walk everywhere with no problem while I was away at work. no beaches but nice parks, a kids gym, shops and a starbucks. The hotel is a bit odd. Not your standard Residence Inn, but all the fundamentals are there. The "interior" of the hotel is really an outside compound where you find the rooms, the parking, the pool etc... All of this seems all right for Florida. The secure parking is a bonus and provides nice peace of mind. The room, in our case a one bedroom suite, was very clean with all the amenities of a Residence Inn. The house keeping was erratic. Some days it was cleaned with extra care, other days just a quick once through. Never dirty though. For some reason, towels are not in abundance. The customer service was also erratic. Some front desk clerks not greeting guests who come and go, breakfast staff not clearing tables in time.It seems, at times, only the managers were interested in the welfare of the customers, while the employees were not so much, particularly the front desk. Not trying to make a blanket statement, but definitely these employees need to be aware of some of the finer points of customer service The biggest annoyances, however, was that the cable in the bedroom would mysteriously cut out. And the phone in the bedroom would also mysteriously ring in the night, sometimes long, sometimes short. Some minor technical glitches, not show stoppers, but glitches. I don't know why these things would happen.

Reviews.Title: “will come back again”
Reviews.Author: Mokaccino20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed from July 3rd until July 9th 2011. The inn is really clean and the full kitchen is very useful if you wish to cook your own meal. If not, the breakfest or dinner buffet will satisfy you or by 5-10 min of walk there is plenty of bars and restaurants available on CoconutWalk. South Beach is about 10 to 15 min away by car so the beach is never too far. Every single person of the staff was really helpful and the wi-fi in every room just add another pleasant touch to your stay. The tv connection dropped once or twice but..... We didn't really care.... Watching tv wasn't the main goal of our vacations! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Pinguero
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn during December and found the hotel to be very comfortable for a long term stay. The rooms have a small kitchen with all the necessary appliances for cooking. Breakfast was included and was good. The staff at the breakfast area were very friendly and attentive. Staff at the front desk were a hit or miss, sometimes very friendly and polite at other time rude and uninterested. Parking was not cheap at $15 a night. The best thing about the hotel is the location in Coconut Grove, one of Miami's best areas. The hotel is a block from the shops at Cocowalk and also about a 5 minute walk from Biscayne Bay and several marinas. There are also several great restaurants in the neighborhood. Overall would definitely stay in this hotel again mainly because of its great location.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL Customer Service. Very Rude!”
Reviews.Author: Lizabeth034
Reviews.Content: I just received by far the worst customer service of any hotel that I have ever stayed in. I travel very often for busy and never have I encountered a staff, including the general manager, that was completely unwilling and downright rude when I tried to work with them. I needed to cancel my room because the rest of the party that I am traveling with was staying at a different Marriott property nearby. Because this room was pre-booked they were completely unwilling to cancel the room and refund the rate, even though I was staying at another Marriott property. I understand that hotels have booking policies but the fact that they were completely unwilling to make any exceptions is ridiculous. This is a service industry, a fact that is lost on the staff at this hotel. VERY disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean rooms in an excellent locaion”
Reviews.Author: Angie S
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of my expecations, and the staff exceeded them. I typically stay at the Marriot Dadeland when in town (which is often) but I had out of the country business guests that preferred a place where they could cook their own food and I wanted to stay near to them as I was providing transportation. I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the rooms and the excellent service provided by the front desk. They had that above and beyond attitude that is rare. The location is great. It's walking distance from a few great restaurants and the water. The parking fee ($15) is very good good considering the gated lot and distance from your actual room.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gwen1024
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very family friendly. A good breakfast was served daily; the staff was very friendly, professional and helpful. Staff responded to issues promptly. The location was close to main attractions and the airport. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. There was also a gated entrance to the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Congenial”
Reviews.Author: Melo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night, but would have been happy to stay longer if possible. Although there was a $15 parking fee, I felt that the car was secure and we were within walking distance of our dinner restaurant...Jaguar (excellent, by the way). The breakfast buffet was very good. The staff was always cheerful and polite. Seemed a little "motel like", but it's Florida.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: yaelyo
Reviews.Content: Based on this hotel's overall ranking I was not expecting much. We had originally booked at the Courtyard Marriott in Coral Gables, but when we got there (after midnight), the last room left didn't have a working air conditioner. So they got us a replacement room at this Residence Inn a few blocks away. The parking deck at the Residence Inn charges a daily rate ($15, I think) which is annoying since other nearby hotels don't (like the Courtyard). The room was clean. The king size bed was comfortable. Like a lot of Florida hotels, there was a humid feeling the whole time like the air conditioner couldn't quite keep up. The kitchenette in the room seemed older but recently repainted. The bathroom was small. The sheets and bed linens were comfortable, but our towels seemed thin and scratchy. Access to the rooms is from the exterior -- not an interior hall -- which seemed a little low-end considering the rate for the room. The breakfast buffet (free) looked really good, but the manager was really, really rude to me about the waffle iron. My waffle stuck, and he asked rudely if I'd used a special spray first. I hadn't, but I had followed the directions on a large printed poster. And at a Drury and Hampton recently, the waffle irons didn't require me to spray them first. He was really irritated and started scraping my waffle off, even though I was going to do that myself and eat it in parts. I just grabbed a yogurt and left, really irritated, after that. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, but there's nothing really wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, clean hotel, fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: We have spent nearly three weeks here while our house is being renovated. I was a little concerned about staying here given the uneven reviews I had read on Tripadvisor. I have only wonderful things to say about our stay. The staff go above and beyond every day. Everyone is friendly, they always ask if everything is going okay with our stay, if there is anything that is needed, and if they can help with anything. During our stay the hotel had a large group staying here and the service did not suffer one bit. I think it is remarkable that all the staff are friendly and polite from housekeeping, grounds, front desk staff to the General Manager. Everyone pitches in to do whatever is necessary. The rooms are clean, spacious, and quiet. We could not hear anything from other rooms and there was very little noise from the hall even though we were right next to the stairs. The complimentary breakfast buffet has everything anyone could want to eat -- 4 kinds of cereal and hot oatmeal, scrambled eggs, waffles, juice, "egg mcmuffin" type sandwiches, sausage, pancakes, toast, muffins, bagels, coffee, 4 kinds of juice, etc. The pool was nice and warm and the children and I enjoyed several swims in it. Parking at the hotel is convenient and secure. The hotel is within walking distance of all main retail part (stores/restaurants) the Grove. The general manager Sam Kelly does a fabulous job of running this hotel. I recommend staying here without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: j0e31
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here with a group of over 50 people. The staff at this hotel was wonderful, especially the front desk staff, Melissa, Leonardo and Marlene. The rooms were always clean and the complimentary breakfast buffet was plentiful.The general manager Sam does a superb job and we will def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jruss63
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Residence Inn Coconut Grove in Miami, FL. The staff went above and beyond in every way. Great breakfast and reception at night was more than enough food & variety. Staff members were always on hand to pitch in, talking with us and ensuring everything was okay with our stay. Rooms were big and clean & is a nice walk to area shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Needs soundproofing!”
Reviews.Author: nessie421
Reviews.Content: I really don't like writing bad reviews and I wanted to like this place... We are big fans of the Residence Inn chain. We have done two international moves with four cats and now a baby as well and we like them because they tend to be spacious, clean, accept pets, and have awesome breakfasts. I agree with previous reviewers that this is not like other RI's. The bedrooms and bathrooms are much smaller than the other 3 RI's we have stayed in, but our biggest complaint was the noise. The hotel is spread out motel-style and our room was on the ground floor, just a few feet from one of the pools (there are two small pools) and we could hear everything. Every splash, laugh, shriek... The pool is supposed to close at 10 pm, but several nights people were partying by the pool, drinking bottles of beer (which isn't allowed) and talking/laughing very loudly. I had to call the front desk several times to complain. After a few nights of this, I spoke to one of the managers at breakfast and she was very polite, apologetic, and professional, and even sent a bag of goodies to our room, which was kind of her, and that night the front desk staff did go to kick out people after 10 pm. However, the soundproofing was bad everywhere. The walls were so thin I could hear the people in the room next to us talking, their tv, dog barking, etc. I feel bad for them as we had an 6 month old baby with us, who, despite our best efforts, did occasionally cry... Furthermore, since the hotel is motel-style and we were on the ground floor, we had to keep our curtains drawn at all times, as people would be passing by and also would be in the pool, making us feel like we were living in a cave. Breakfast was always extremely crowded and several times they ran out of food and there was nowhere to sit. Our last night was awful - someone pulled the fire alarm at 1 am and then it kept going off hourly as no one at the front desk called the fire department to reset it!! (my husband went to complain around 4 am and the person said, "We think it's a prank and the alarm just keeps going off because no one's called the FD to reset it" to which he responded that it might be a good idea for them to do that!!). Lastly, RI have free dinners some nights and one of the nights we planned on attending was listed on the sheet on the fridge as starting at 7:30 pm, but it was apparently a typo and started at 5:30 pm. Considering the activities sheet is for the month and this was at the end of the month, they should have either reprinted the sheet or had housekeeping change it. It was frustrating when we were planning on getting dinner that way (always difficult with a young baby). The good parts: Coconut Grove is a fun area and the hotel is walking distance to many stores and restaurants; the breakfast is varied; the fitness room was much nicer than most hotels'; plentiful parking; free Wi-Fi; accept pets (extra charge). We would not stay here again because of all of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: mom2twoboys44
Reviews.Content: the price was more reasonable than other places I looked at. The rooms were spacious, and kitchen functional. I didn't use anything but the refrigerator. The shower curtain was too short though, and I had a hard time keeping the water from going outside the tub while I was showering. Huge closets, much more that I needed for a long weekend. This building used to be apartments many years ago, my grandfather actually had an apartment in the same complex 16 years ago. Had breakfast one morning, and loved the waffle iron and fresh batter to make a waffle. I would recommend if you are looking for a place not in the middle of town but within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “nice little extended stay”
Reviews.Author: mstru
Reviews.Content: stayed here once before and came back. this hotel is a little older, so it needs a little upgrade, but it has an apartment feel which is nice if you have to stay for an extended stay. breakfast is nothing special, but it's free, so no real reason to complain. the best part about this hotel is the location. just five minutes south is the grove shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: Warren C
Reviews.Content: We had a gathering of 5 siblings and our 95 year old Mother. The staff was incredible nice and attentive to all of us but especially our Mother. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. There were lots of restaurants nearby and a variety to accomodate our tastes. It even allowed Mom to go back to the room after a lunch or dinner and we could quickly get to downtown for business or Miami Beach for some fun. The location was so incredibly convenient. We all look forward to coming back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Felt it was fake Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Heather F
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe this is really a Marriott. The outside is embarrassingly hideous. The inside is dated and appears unclean. A/C works great. Noise level is extremely high. Traffic and drunk partiers everywhere. Breakfast is a joke. I think we got the worse room in the house. We had to bend over to go in the doorway which was under a beam located next to the tiny pool (which had no lounge chairs). Location is excellent but I feel like this is Marriott's forgotten child.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: ibskine
Reviews.Content: Overall hotel is clean and staff is wonderful. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and it was plenty of room. Both rooms were nicely furnished as well as the living room and kitchen. The room was not very soundproof though. Traffic on the street below as well as children in the exterior hallway could be easily heard. The only other issue was that the air conditioner seemed to be small for the unit. It worked hard the entire stay and only cooled the room to about 75 deg F. The garage below was nice and gated for security. Movie theater, comedy club and a nice assortment of restaurants within walking distance. I have stayed at several hotels in the area and probably will stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but should not be a Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: topherashley
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst Marriott properties I have ever visited. The location is excellent for access to Coconut Grove. If you are visting to party at Cocowalk and will simply be walking back to your room and passing out, this place serves its purpose. The only reason I gave this property 2 stars was due to the gated parking, without that I would have had a totally sleepiness night. The rooms are tired, worn down, and the bed (a double) sleeps awful. The exterior is just gross. Rundown, shady characters, and a complete lack of maintenance. The walls are PAPER THIN. I was awoken by a party going on next door at 5am and could literally hear every word of the conversation as if I was in the room with them. The staff is apathetic and unbecoming of any other Marriott property. I'm not one to complain about hotels, check my reviews, but unless you get a FANTASTIC deal, or are a broke spring breaker or college student, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: chrisMiddlengland
Reviews.Content: Polite & efficient check-in. Smallish room but with a very big balcony. Fixtures and furniture all upmarket and very clean. Big TV and very comfortable bed were a noticable difference to the cheaper motel chains. Appliances (fridge, coffee-maker, free wireless) all worked. When the ice-maker on the floor broke, someone came to fix it promptly. My only gripe is the Ryanair-approach to pricing: we paid $ 77 / night - which sounds really good value, except that it isn't: car parking is $20 per day and there is no real alternative in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mmiller623
Reviews.Content: The area is very quiet and nice place to visit. I recommend taking a walk down to Coco Walk. Plenty of shopping and dining within walking distance. The hotel was clean, staff very nice and helpful. Breakfast was really good. I will stay here again when back in this area. The only down side was Verizons fault but did add to my quiet stay. I had no signal around this hotel. Signal was okay in the courtyard and pool area but in the room phone would ring then call would drop. Typical Verizon.

Reviews.Title: “OLD and TIRED”
Reviews.Author: theworldisnotenought
Reviews.Content: This property is old and has a funny smell in the rooms....Plenty of room but you rather not touch the carpet or bedspred....$15 parking is extra.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MeTraveler13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in Miami for our daughter's college graduation. I was nervous after reading some of the reviews but didn't find any problems with cleanliness. The breakfasts was great and the room was very spacious. The only down side was we requested. Quiet room so we were far from the wifi hub and I couldn't access it from my iPad. They offered to move our room but it wasn't worth the hassle since we had. Already unpacked. We didn't use the pool but it was great to be able to walk to the Grove

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, like home.”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: I was there before heading to the keys to work, I'm happy that I stay there. Big suites, clean, great location, and wonderful breakfast. It's huge breakfast many options, two pools and laundry it's a great deal. Specially for people on the go. I hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: alexsinanan
Reviews.Content: Having booked my stay at this Residence Inn in a 2 bedroom unit, I began reading reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor and became extremely nervous, particularly with regard to the cleanliness of this hotel. Once we arrived, check in was extremely speedy and the staff explained the parking arrangements. Our 2 bedroom suite was spacious and more than adequate for 2 adults and 2 children. The room was clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, with more than enough pillows and an endless supply of clean towels. The pool and breakfast were more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good breakfast, unusual layout”
Reviews.Author: kellbert
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a comfortable hotel near the airport for one night and I found this hotel to quite good. It is well located for dining and shoppping but because it is in a congested area the grounds are limited and parking costs extra. I loved the room and wished I could have stayed longer. They are actually one bedroom suites and are quite roomy. A family of 4 or 5 would be quite happy. There are flat screen TVs in the bedroom and living area and the kitchen is adequate for a long stay. The breakfast was included in the rate and was quite good. In had a make you own waffle station and more that enough variety of food items. I guess it could get quite busy when the hotel is full but it was quite during my stay. I hate paying for parking but it is located underground or behind the hotel. The property is a bit congested and confusing as it attempts to make a resort on a downtown site. It doesn't quite work but I suppose if you don't have a car, the location is good for shopping and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Felt more like a cheap dive than a Residence Inn...”
Reviews.Author: sjf1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property twice on business. I love the location in Coconut Grove. My first stay was in a studio suite, dated but not unbearable, so I decided to try it again. My second stay was in a one bedroom apartment towards the back of the property. It was a very depressing room, musty, noisy, and just well...yucky! I am typically a big fan of Residence Inn by Marriott for business travel. This particular hotel is very dated and is more like a run-down motel and nothing like the newer contemporary Residence Inn properties. I really wish I could take a new Residence Inn and plop it down on top of this one. Self-park and free breakfast and internet were nice features. Close walk to restaurants and shopping in Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Not Marriott Quality or Service!”
Reviews.Author: traveler007FL
Reviews.Content: Marriott Corporate needs to do an audit on this hotel! As a frequent Marriott guest this hotel is the worst Marriott I have ever stayed at. Hairs all over bathroom floor, musty room, dirty and dingy room interior, hairs and debris in the bathroom counter drawers. It appears more time is spent on the plantings around the hotel than in keeping the rooms clean and orderly. Only positives I can say aare the breakfast was good and had a nice variety, and the location is optimal. We cut our stay short and have definately crossed this hotel off our list - let's just hope Marriott is not lessening its standard of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: Deniseinfl
Reviews.Content: Could not believe this was a Marriott. Very outdated & dirty. Staff totally unhelpful. Area is convenient, but that is the only decent thing I can say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy22030
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Residence Inn is the ability to spread out! With a 1 or 2 BR, you are not crammed into one room. This Residence Inn has been renovated, but is still a little dated. Parking lot is small, and hard to find spots sometimes. The staff is very friendly. The free breakfast is good-but does get crowded. The location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and noise a problem”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Tripper22
Reviews.Content: This suite was definitely in need of renovating. In living room, the carpet needed a good vacuuming and cleaning. The furniture needs to be reupholstered or at the very least, cleaned. I can take old if it is clean !!! The suite had the musty smell of an unkept room Noise of traffic and sirens during the day and night was a problem. Especially at night if you are a light sleeper.. It was great having a kitchenette in the suite, The breakfast provided downstairs was good. Their staff was friendly and very accommodating. I realize this is an older building, but if the other suites are like this one, it is obvious that this inn is on the decline, It could be improved greatly with some attention to thorough cleaning and/or updating the suites. At present, I could not recommend this inn.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Motel”
Reviews.Author: madbaby
Reviews.Content: We usually adore staying in Residence Inns, and seek them out when we are traveling. We have a small child, so having the separate bedroom is a huge plus for us. This Residence Inn is set up like a motel. The rooms are accessible from an outside walkway. We were assigned a room in "building 1", which looked like it had not been renovated since the 1980s, and literally looked like a room from a bad crime TV show. There was hair stuck to the doorframe in the bathroom glued to it with some sort of scum, and a chunk of food or something (hope it was food!?!) stuck to the arm of the sofa. I was grossed out and we moved to a different nearby hotel, which was much, much better. I wouldn't spend the night in such a filthy room. ICK!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Coconut Grove AND 20 minutes from MIA”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeaucoup
Reviews.Content: A few blocks walk from the Marina and the centre of Coconut Grove. Huge room, free wifi, breakfast not bad, coffee machine, fridge, cooker, dishwasher in room. We stumbled upon the hotel and the rate was good, and even had a "Social evening" that night with free chili, hotdogs, beer, wine and softdrinks. Good fitness centre / Gym - not that we use it, but it's there. Also a small pool. The lifts are slow. Underground parking for a fee ($11) The hotel is about 20 minutes from MIA, so why stay at the airport when you could stay here. Town doesn't only seems to offer Chilis and Hooters style food, but go to the Marina and there is a Chart House and other restaurants which are a bit more up market. Ask before you go, because Chart House was a little tricky to find.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD, GREAT ROOM”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: Great room size, and amenities beth, bath body. I like the place a lot, very clean, great breakfast buffet (pricey) and the valet parking is like 20 bucks. Overall is great.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: campers7
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Residence Inn at 3:00 a.m. after a delayed flight into Fort Lauderdale and a car rental problem. Was greeted by a woman at the front desk who was very kind and accommodating. We ended up not having to pay the parking fee and got a late check out which was great. The rooms were spacious, a bit out dated, but clean and met our needs. The kitchen would have been perfect if we had been able to stay longer, but we had already booked elsewhere for the next several days. Area looked safe, breakfast was very nice. Wished we had not had a nonrefundable reservation for the next two nights or would have stayed longer. About 7-10 min. drive to Univ. of Miami where we went to visit my daughter. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the Miami Area”
Reviews.Author: KidsinAmerica
Reviews.Content: We read reviews of this hotel regarding its motel-like set up and were slightly wary of the quality of what we were booked into, having stayed at many high-end Marriotts. We were very pleasantly surprised that although it does have balconies and external doors to all rooms, it was a very well laid out, clean welcoming hotel. The room was very spacious for a family of 4 (separate bedroom for Mum & Dad) and the usual facilities found in a Residence Inn. We noticed no annoying street noise despite the motel set up. The hotel had 2 outdoor pools which the kids (12 & 13) enjoyed - both in secluded courtyards, one each side of the hotel, and secure parking (although this was $10/day). It is a 15 min drive to the beach at Miami Beach and much cheaper than the beachfront hotels. Closer to the hotel within walking distance was CocoWalk, a collection of shops, restaurants and movie theatre (recommend the Cheesecake Factory - great food and service). Hotel staff were really friendly and the breakfast (included) was very good. All in all, a really great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Miami - 2 great days”
Reviews.Author: Wicki
Reviews.Content: After flying in from Europe we stayed at the Residence Inn Miami Coconut Grove for 3 nights in a 2-bedroom-appartment. Our stay could not have been better. As a fan of Residence Inns we booked this hotel knowing what to get, and we got it: A perfect, super clean appartment (the only surprise was, that we just had one bathroom - ok to us - but unusual for a 2-bedroom-app. at Residence Inns), a very very good every-morning-breakfast-buffet, a nice pool to spend a few moments after having visited downtown or Miami Beach. Staff was very nice, room-service perfect. Fitness-Center good, Wireless ok. Parking was 10 USD/day but in a very good and big parking-lot under the hotel, which was great as we had severe weather at our first day in Miami and could get to our car dry!!! This Residence Inn is in easy walking-distance to the Cocowalk where you can find plenty of restaurants to go to and have a good time in the evenings. You will always feel safe when walking in this neighbourhood. Downtown, Key Biscayne and Miami Beach are easy and quickly accessibly by car. No worries. We decided to stay here and not at Miami Beach as we - as I mentioned - love Red. Inns and of course, travelling with two teenies it was much cheaper for us to stay in a 2-bedroom-app. here than to need two rooms in a motel at Miami Beach. We loved to go there but also loved to return to a more quiet place to sleep for than busy Miami Beach. Well, I guess family-taste... I would always come back here for a next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JackFlynn
Reviews.Content: More of a motel than a hotel, but not in a bad way. Big rooms with a kitchen and living room. Great location, within walking distance of a concentration of shops and restaurants called The Coco Walk. They include a pretty good continental breakfast too. I got it for $78 a night on President's Day, using Priceline. Be aware though, they charge $11.50 per day parking.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: bsmull
Reviews.Content: As noted by other reviewers, location relative to local shopping/restaurants is excellent. Structure is on the tired-worn side, sports a fairly bizarre layout with slow elevators, slow internet connection. Biggest disappointment was learning that evening social hour has been reduced to a few times per month. Manager at check-out (who to his credit asked about quality of my stay) reports this is chain-wide, but not sure of that. In sum, when you take away those percs there's really not much to differentiate the chain. This will certainly influence my future booking decisions...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: grayt63
Reviews.Content: Had stayed here before but will skip next time. The rooms are starting to show their age and the rooms feel really old. Also hotel is very noisy both from the street and from rooms next to us. The hotel pool looked very old, dirty, and never used. The staff was just average and not very friendly. Not up to what I expect in a Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Spacious Suite and Great Nearby Shops and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Jaxmimi
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travel, we were able to check in early. The friendly staff provided a map of the nearby shops, all within easy walking distance. The parking was easy and the location was great. The full breakfast had a lot to offer. We had a slight problem with the internet, but enjoyed the roomy suite. Nice flat screen TVs in bedroom and living room. The pool was small, but adequate. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Cruise-Addic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. We were pleasantly surprised. Hotel management (Sam and Jennyfer) and staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive. We requested extra towels and received them within minutes. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. We rented a two bedroom unit for 4 adults and it was more than adequate. Beds were very comfortable and sheets were clean. While not on the beach, it does have a great pool area with tables, chairs and loungers. Included in the price is a delicious breakfast buffet. This buffet is excellent - hot/cold cereals, bagels, toast, sausage rounds, french toast, eggs, waffles, yogourt, fresh fruit, juices, tea and coffee! Lots of variety and eat as much as you want! Three nights during the week there was also a free manager's reception, which included drinks(wine and beer) and a variety of food - one night was a wine and cheese and another night hamburgers were served.This is a fantastic hotel for the price and we would definitely stay here again. We have no reservation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MornaTMichigan
Reviews.Content: We booked two suites at this property for a week. The suites are big enough, but lighting is poor, furniture uncomfortable. Nice TV's though. My grandson enjoyed the pool--no one was ever there. The staff was very friendly and responsive to any request. There was a managers reception on only one night of our stay--not every night like our past experiences with Residence Inns. The parking is a nighmare---not enough conveniently located, and the gate often does not open. There is a call button, which will get it to open--but it is a hassle. Our bill was charged for multiple daily parking fees, although we only had one car. Check your billing carefully---overall I expected much more for the price--we could have had individual rooms at another property for less. The location is convenient. This property needs some updating---the price is based on location only--not what you get in ammenities. The breakfast seems to rotate every two days---eggs in a bag and lots of carbs! Long waits for the waffle maker. The strength of this property is the staff, which exceeded expectations. We would probably not stay here again should we return to the area however, as it is not a good value relative to the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay pre-post cruises”
Reviews.Author: suzyindiana
Reviews.Content: We had a group (family) of 12 that went on a Carnival cruise the first part of September. We had 3 different rooms. I stayed with 5 others in the group in a 2 bedroom suite. It was really nice. The staff here is very nice and willing to give you information on things around the area. Some in our group visited the Coconut Grove night scene (clubs). It is a short walk from the hotel. The staff gave us information on places to eat and also gave us great directions on how to get there. We stayed here Saturday and Sunday before our cruise and Friday after our cruise. Each morning they have a free breakfast. This isn't your usual stale donuts, coffee and juice type of breakfast. They have a waffle machine where you can make waffles. They also have potatoes, sausage, biscuits and sausage gravy, cereals, grits, oatmeal, breads, fruit toppings for the waffles, many different kinds of tea etc. Excellent breakfast and great service. If we ever get a chance to take another cruise out of Miami we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Guayaquil2
Reviews.Content: Like last time , very good, great service, great price , great location , clean , secure, every they offer , they do.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: momuv3
Reviews.Content: We had to come to Miami for a wedding and stayed to take a cruise--during spring break! South Beach was out of the question, even though the wedding was over there. So, in looking around, found Residence in 2 bedroom suite for our family of 5. What a pleasant surprise! We arrived early afternoon, since the wedding was early evening. No rooms were ready. I had requested early check-in, but it wasn't in our record. However, the desk staff found a handicap accessible room had just come available, and offered it to us-first floor, but 2 bedrooms. Can't say no to that! Although the rooms smelled a little musty (a Florida problem?) the dehumidifier was a nice addition! The courtyard was gorgeous with all the flowering plants, and seating, and grill area. It's in a gated property, also a plus. The next morning, at breakfast, one of the staff made a point to ask how the wedding went the evening before and to apologize, again, for not having our room ready earlier! I think he may have been the manager. I regret that I didn't catch his name. The breakfast was more than fine, the waffles really good! The coffee was quite good, too! We spent 2 nights there, and would come back if the need arises. A very nice experience. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff Around and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: burchard
Reviews.Content: Agree with last review. This hotel is not particularily glamorous but clean and in a great location - walking distance to Coco Walk with many stores and restaurants. The staff was extremely friendly and breakfast was nice. My only complaint was that I had used Marriott points for the two nights and they ended up charging me a room charge. I tried to call the hotel to resolve directly but the billing supervisor never called me back so I had to dispute through credit card. Other than that issue everything was perfect and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncommon Graciousness in Tight Quarters”
Reviews.Author: Scubatripper
Reviews.Content: Resident Inn's are among the more reliable and consistent of the all-suite hotels and the Residence Inn Coconut Grove maintained that tradition. I was on a family vacation with my wife and two teenage daughters and booked a 2-bedroom suite. It was a typical RI with outside entrances into a Spartan, but appropriately furnished Living room with small dining area and a galley kitchen off to the side. The two bedrooms were almost equal in size. Beds and furniture were comfortable and had that RI touch of being utilitarian, but appealingly modern. Overall, space is a bit tight, but functional. Surprisingly, there was only one en suite bath, and that was very small with only one sink. There were three TVs, one in each bedroom and one in the living room with a large selection of channels including HBO. The free internet was fine, although they should consider going wireless since the ethernet provides for only one user at a time, and as I mentioned, I had two teenage daughters. There were two small, kidney-shaped pools in this fairly sprawling complex. The hotel has gated entrances to the parking area, although this security was defeated by a side entrance gate that was always open. This hotel has easy access to the main North-South Florida highways and is a few short blocks from main Coconut Grove areas including the touristy CocoWalk. RI served a free hot & cold breakfast although the steam-table scrambled eggs and sausage patties were usually overdone. The staff of the Coconut Grove Residence Inn, from the manager to the cleaning staff was exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to help you out. The Coconut Grove RI isn't the lap of luxury, but strikes a balance between comfort and price. We got it at $256, AAA rate. Restaurant Recommendations: Do you self a favor and skip the generic, mall ubiquitous Hooters and Cheesecake Factory in CocoWalk. In the next two blocks are a couple of great restaurants. For great Latin American style seafood and ceviche, Jaguar. When that Residence Inn breakfast gets tired, which it will after two days, go to the Green Street CafÃ©. And go there again for lunch and dinner. Great vibe, and really good grill food

Reviews.Title: “OK stay, though a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: aerofl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Inn Coconut Grove for three nights with our daughter and son-in-law and grandaughter. I chose this hotel because it had a two bedroom/two bath suite which included a full kitchen and living and dining area. I had read all the reviews on Tripadvisor and tried to adjust my expectations accordingly. Our previous stays in Coconut Grove had always been at the Mayfair Hotel and Spa. We paid a AAA rate of $289 per night for the suite, which was far less expensive than two rooms at the Mayfair and gave us gathering room and space for the baby to play. The hotel is located about three blocks from the Mayfair Shops and CocoWalk. We could see the Sofitel Hotel just off the entrance to the hotel and the Ritz Carlton was just a couple of blocks away. We very much liked the location, in a quieter semi-residential area. The Mayfair Hotel has the disadvantage of being in party central and with quite a bit of outside noise very late at night. Our first impression of the hotel was somewhat unfavorable. It looks like a very old condo re-do, and though I expected the outdoor entrances to the suites, it looked a little "iffy" to me. Check-in was very nice and friendly, very efficient. We had requested a crib for the baby and it was delivered promptly. For those of you with infants, it was not an actual crib, but a "pack and play" crib/playpen combo. What was very nice is that they provide a pack of bedding for the crib that included fitted sheets for the mattress and extra blankets of crib size. We did have to set up the crib ourselves, which took only a few minutes. The suite itself was relatively disappointing to me. Upon entering, you are in the dining/kitchen/living area. A small dining table pushed up against the window that could seat four if you moved it away from the window. The living area was tiny - a recliner chair and a sofa that could seat three, coffee table, one side table with a lamp and a small stand with a TV. Lighting was inadequate and would have made working here very difficult. The kitchen had a full size fridge, microwave, dishwasher, stove, sink (no disposal) with cabinetry. There were simple kitchen untensils, a toaster, dishes, etc. for four along with basic pots and pans. Everything was extremely clean. Paper towels, dishcloths, dishwasher and dish soap provided. The two bedrooms and baths were just off the living area. Our bedroom was very tight - queen bed, two night stands, one small dresser with three drawers, TV, iron and ironing board in the closet. The second bedroom was a bit larger, more storage space, same furnishings. Both the bedrooms had the Marriott Revive beddng - good matresses, fine quality bedding. The two bathrooms were not en suite, but had to be accessed from the common hallway. One bathroom was completely contained behind closed doors, the other had the sink open to the hall with the toilet and shower behind a closed door. This was OK for us as a family, but if you had to share with another couple, privacy might be an issue. There were plentiful, good quality towels and shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion provided. Hairdryers for both baths, extra TP and Kleenex under both sinks. Housekeeping was attentive and efficient. They always honored the Do Not Disturb sign on the door and seemed to clean the room the moment we left. We did have a couple of room issues - one clogged sink and an outlet that didn't work. When we reported this to the front desk the repairs were made while we were out for a couple of hours and a message was left on the phone to confirm our satisfaction with the repairs. The hotel rate included breakfast each morning (6:30 to 9:30 am weekdays, 7:00 to 10:00 am weekends) and an evening social from 5:00 to 7:00 pm Mon-Thurs. We weren't able to take advantage of these offerings, but thought that was a great added value to the room rate. There are two small pools located on the property, but weather didn't permit our using this feature. Three of our group used the small gym and thought it was well maintained with an adequate array of equipment in excellent condition. There is a guest laundry on the premise. This hotel didn't quite meet my expectations, but I rated it neutral/average for several reasons. The employees are great and the service provided is excellent. The property is very clean and well maintained. The biggest selling point is the value. We never intended to spend much time in the room (which was pretty disappointing to me, though not to my husband and daughter and son-in-law) and the rate proved to be an excellent value. Great location, great employees, excellent value in a very expensive part of Miami. I would stay here again, I would recommend it to budget conscious family and friends. So much to see and do close by - University of Miami, Key Biscayne, South Beach, museums, shopping etc. Do a better job of adjusting your expectations than I did and you will be surprised by the great employees and excellent value of this Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: shan_luv2travel
Reviews.Content: From the exterior, this hotel doesn't look terribly impressive. However, the service, location, and room itself were great. First, the staff - very friendly, very helpful. Checking in and out was easy and we had no problems. We were even able to leave our rental car in the hotel garage on Sunday until it was time to head back to the airport, which was very convenient. The location is great - just a short walk to CocoWalk (Cheesecake Factory, CafÃ© Tu Tu Tango) and other shopping and restaurants. My husband and I had lunch at Jaguar, which was fun (good Sangria and ceviche). We also took a walk over to the marina to look at the boats, which was enjoyable. I'm not sure about some of the other reviewers saying this must be in a bad area, this hotel is directly across the street from the Ritz-Carlton and other upscale establishments -- I certainly didn't feel unsafe. We were also able to easily catch a cab to South Beach (around $30). The room, while not ultra luxurious (not sleek, new appliances, but a nicely appointed kitchen nonetheless), was perfectly fine in my opinion. Everything was very clean and the bed was really comfy. Complimentary breakfast in the lobby was terrific â€“ wide variety of hot and cold foods and nothing ran out. So overall, this is just a nice, suitable hotel and I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: CanadianInMotion
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel before a cruise and had a good experience. As other reviews indicate, it's convenient to CocoWalk and other shops and outlets. Our room was fine although the major appliances were old and warn. This is not your regular Residence Inn - it is quite obviously a converted older hotel/motel complex. The room decor is great but the external corridors and multiple buildings are different from most RI's I've experienced. The front desk people were great - very helpful and the included breakfast was as good as I've had at any RI. I recommend the Residence Inn Miami Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid his Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lufcpaul1
Reviews.Content: Once into the parking lot, you know it is more like a jail than a hotel. This is not a Residence Inn, this is not a hotel. Metal Bars are everywhere, if security is this bad, no one should be staying in this hotel. My room 3250 had broken tiles throughout the bathroom, this left mold everywhere. The previous guests soap(s) were still in the bathroom! My room had bed-bugs and when I told reception, they said "sorry" I explained I had killed 3, and the lady said "They lay eggs" No we will comp your awful room, no we will discount your awful experience. My room was like "Grand Central Station" Coconut Grove is not very nice, in fact in is a HOLE and looking at this hotel, I know why.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for $, But a Little Noisy”
Reviews.Author: boltnut55
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights here. The location is great, the rooms are clean, the food is a bonus, and there was ample parking, so it received a 4 star. The only minus was the thin walls, and the fact that I could hear road noise. Coconut Grove is about 15-20 minutes (max) away from South Beach w/o all the craziness. It's also a central location to go to the zoo and REALLY close to the Seaquarium, Vizcaya Museum, and the Science Museum. The rooms seem smaller than the other Residence Inns as if this property belonged to another chain before. It has outside corridors like a motel, except that once you get inside, there's a kitchen and a door in front of the bedroom (we got the 1 bedroom). Room looked recently remodeled (no stained carpet, for example). Bathroom is a little small; I barely had room to dry myself after a shower without banging into the wall or the sink. The bedroom had a full size mirrored closet, and they sent extra hangers when I asked. They have two guest laundries with several washers and dryers (bring your own supplies!), and I hardly saw anyone use them, although we did. Breakfast is free every morning, not just donuts, but a hot breakfast including biscuits and gravy, eggs, and sausage. On M-Th, there is "Happy Hour" of either pasta; soup and salad; or hamburgers. This saved us quite a bit of money (I paid $180/night). On our last night, the food ran out, so there was a lag time in which there wasn't any food for at least 15 minutes. All the employees I observed worked hard and tried hard to please the guests. They are short handed though, so there are sometimes a line with guests waiting a while for help while a clerk is helping solve a complex issue. Sometimes, the phones are ringing one call after another while guests are being helped at the front desk. However, the clerks are always are (or try to be) pleasant. The only thing that bothered me were that the dividing walls were too thin, so I could hear casual conversations (not yelling, although there was that), phone ringing, closing of drawers and closet doors, and other noises. Although it's not on a busy street, every night (even after 1:00-2:00 a.m.) I heard several sirens of emergency vehicles (it's not in a bad area) and cars roaring their engines (not a race drag either). This outside noise didn't bother me as much as the next door noises because I didn't know how long it was going on for or whether they would be considerate of us (we were very quiet after 11:00 p.m.). I requested a quiet room when I booked my reservation, so I was disappointed in the noise... in our case, we slept late every night, so we fell asleep pretty quickly; otherwise, this would be a problem, since one night our next door neighbous were up till at least 1:30 a.m. talking. Another morning, the cell phone rang early morning (7:00'ish), and I could hear his conversation, but I managed to fall asleep again. On my last night, I asked about a quieter area, and a clerk indicated some other buildings that would have been better, so I was bummed I didn't get a better room. However, the bottom line is that I would stay here again because of the location and the value for my money. I couldn't find a better hotel that would have been less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed this stay Ants,Worms, Centipede, Huge Roach”
Reviews.Author: babe8720
Reviews.Content: I regret having to write this review,but feel it is my duty to inform the public about this stay at this Inn. I have stayed here before with minimal problems.I first want to tell you I have a very bad back lots of daily PAIN, so to pack and move from the room would have taken away at least one day ,of my time in Miami, this is why I stuck it out hoping things would have gotten better. The first morning I woke, there were little red ants comingup the drains, so I stopped them up.The next day, a huge centipede, in the bathroom. The next day redish color worms, in my room, bedroom wall, one day worm in sink. On the 3rd. night a roach in the bedroom closet ,bigger than a half dollar.Called for the man on duty to kill this one. On my last night there I took towels and put them under the door where you enter the room, because I saw 2 worms going in the room next to me. Still I woke to a worm on the towel inside my room.The whole time there are worms all over the court yard on walls,also near the pool ,in the pool. The day I left ,I left message for the manager to call me. He called and said he would give me a discount on my stay, that I have yet to see. I have tried to contact the manager numerous times since I left, I keep being told there is no manager working. I leave messages, he does not return my call. I will never stay at a Residence Inn again. Sad !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: urbanguy_rd
Reviews.Content: Good service, the room is simple but well decorated, the bed, sheets, pillows, were comfortable. The employees are kind, overalls in the restaurant during the breakfast, always willing to help. The location of the hotel is excellent!! either for business or vacations like it was my case, there are restaurants and stores very close, a lot nightlife action!!. The breakfast is very complete and comfortable area. My only complaint is about the elevator that is extremely slow, we had to wait up to 10 minutes to be able to ascend, since we were in the floor 5. I would recommend it to any person.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: bookixx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being renovated, but I'm not sure what all is being replaced, as some of the furniture was new, and some of it was really worn, and dated. The front desk staff was not pleasant, and the layout of the overall property is very choppy. If you are waiting for the elevator, be prepared to wait 5-10 minutes - take my advice and just take the stairs. The location is great, in relation to restaurants and shopping, but if you're used to staying in Marriott properties, this one is a disappointment, compared to most others.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Miami Coconut Grove
HotelInfo.Address: 2835 Tigertail Avenue, Coconut Grove, Miami, FL 33133
